description.narrative: MTR - COs and ROs supported for building and improving systems for Early Childhood, Primary and Secondary level education focused on improving learning outcomes and skills development, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Every Child to Learn By 2021, countries apply child-sensitive policies, innovative community-centered approaches and evidence, to implement development and humanitarian interventions at scale, that enable Every Child to Learn

participating-org.narrative: GHANA EDUCATION SERVICE GES HEADQUARTERS EDUCATION SECTOR SUPPO PROJECT
THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House 3 United Nations Plaza New York New York 10017 USA

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - gender-responsive teaching and learning (excluding SRGBV)
System strengthening - mainstreaming of skills development within national education/training system
System strengthening - responsiveness of education/training system to the labour market

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: MTR - COs and ROs supported for building and improving systems for Early Childhood, Primary and Secondary level education focusedon improving learning outcomes and skills development

description.narrative: In a major move to ‘build back better’ following the COVID 19 pandemic,;;UNICEF launched an ambitious program to ‘Reimagine Education’, fostering partnerships between public and private sectors and young people to ensure the most vulnerable communities’ access to digital learning opportunities, while maintaining a multiple-pathway approach to education and training.; Expected to reach 3.5 billion children and young people with world-class digital learning solutions by 2030, the initiative promises to overcome the digital divide, advancing innovative solutions for capacity building of teachers and caregivers and preparing youth with 21st-century skills. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/03/2021
